Contributor: Paus, artist.; Strobridge & Co. Lith., lithographer.; United States Food Administration, publisher.;
Note: Signed "Paus." Date based on America's participation in the war. "No. 32" appears on the bottom left of the poster. "Letter "D" with the initial "P" in it appears on right side of poster. Orientation: Horizontal.
Description: Text says to "save food and defeat frightfulness." Illustration shows wounded people and a Red Cross nurse.
Digital Collection: Allied Posters of World War I
Local Rights Statement: This material is made available for private study, scholarship, and research use. For access to the original or a high resolution reproduction, contact: Temple University Libraries, Special Collections Research Center, scrc@temple.edu, 215-204-8257.
Subject: Food conservation -- United States.; World War, 1914-1918 -- Propaganda.; War posters, American.;

Title: "America : the hope of all who suffer- the dread of all who wrong"
Source: From: "America : the hope of all who suffer- the dread of all who wrong"
